title: Hello.
content:
Hello. I'm a noob to this community.

Like most of you, I played CK when I was 8 years old or something, but I have fond memories of it and occasionally go on big Commander Keen level making crazes--None of them are very good, but hopefully this next round I make will be worth playing.



Anyway, I am just saying hello. I'm quite impressed at how alive this community is, considering it is centered around a 14 year old side scrolling computer game.

crymorenub

title: Re: Hello.
content:
Hello, and welcome!
Hoping to see those levels one day. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]
And yeah, it's indeed a wonder -- there's no classic game like Keen that has such a fan base, I'm sure. It's amazing how much Keen stuff there is available, from pictures to fan games to mods to levels to editing tools to web sites.. And a lot more. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Hello.
content:
Greetings! Glad to have you aboard.

Indeed, it never ceases to surprise me how long this game seems to have endured, and how deeply it seems to affect people. As Galaxieretter, a great Keener who has since left for military service, would say, "Keen is more than a game."

I'd love to see any new levels you create. Maybe you'll find an interest in modding as well. There's a lot that can be done these days to tweak the Keen games into completely new adventures.

title: Re: Hello.
content:
Hello there from a simamalr 'noob' who probbably has even less keening in her blood than you do. I hope you enjoy your stay here.
